title: J9D5: Facilities for solar photovoltaic and battery systems

contentBlocks.title: Main Electrical Switchboard Requirements
items: The main electrical switchboard of a building must contain at least two empty three-phase circuit breaker slots and four DIN rail spaces labelled to indicate the use of each space for:
Be sized to accommodate the installation of solar photovoltaic panels producing their maximum electrical output on at least 20% of the building roof area.

contentBlocks.title: Roof Area Requirements
items: At least 20% of the roof area of a building must be left clear for the installation of solar photovoltaic panels, except for buildings:
- With installed solar photovoltaic panels on at least 20% of the roof area; or
- With an equivalent generation capacity elsewhere on-site; or
- Where 100% of the roof area is shaded for more than 70% of daylight hours; or
- With a roof area of not more than 55 mÂ²; or
- Where more than 50% of the roof area is used as a terrace, carpark, roof garden, roof light or the like.

contentBlocks.title: Limitations and Exemptions
items: The requirements for solar photovoltaic system spaces and sizing do not apply to a building with solar photovoltaic panels installed on at least 20% of the roof area.
The requirements for battery system spaces and sizing do not apply to a building with battery systems installed.
